title: Phenytoin (Dilantin) Correction for Albumin/Renal Failure
desc: The Phenytoin (Dilantin) Correction for Albumin / Renal Failure corrects serum phenytoin level for renal failure and/or hypoalbuminemia.

data.evidence:
Corrected phenytoin = measured phenytoin level/( (adjustment x albumin, g/dL) + 0.1)

Adjustment = 0.275; in patients with creatinine clearance <20 mL/min, adjustment = 0.2.

Note: no correction is needed for albumin >3.2 g/dL. This calculation is derived from the original Winter-Tozer formula, which used an albumin coefficient of 0.2, and 0.1 for renal failure.
data.facts: The “Sheiner-Tozer Equation” is the official name of this correction.

inputs.name: albumin
inputs.tips_en: If albumin >3.2 g/dL (32 g/L), this correction is not needed
